newsitem.title: CANADA: PC DOCS, Cognos battered on earnings.
newsitem.headline: PC DOCS, Cognos battered on earnings.

text.p: High technology firms PC DOCS Group International Inc and Cognos Inc both dropped on Thursday after news surrounding their earnings.
PC DOCS said late Wednesday that it would release weaker than forecast third quarter earnings while Cognos on Thursday reported a record fourth quarter as expected by analysts.
PC DOCS ares lost 1.85 to reach a new 52-week low of 6.90 in light trading while Cognos slipped 0.50 to 38.00 on the Toronto Stock Exchange.
PC DOCS, maker of intranet and client/server information management systems, said earnings will plunge to C$0.02 a share from a year-earlier C$0.19 due to weaker than expected overseas business, .
Griffiths McBurney Partners analyst Howard Lis said that "it's the second quarter this fiscal year that they pre-released disappointing numbers."
However, analysts had expected the news since competitors have released poor earnings results as well, Lis added. "This didn't come as a complete surprise."
Lis said that trading was light since PC DOCS also announced a normal course issuer bid, prompting many investors to avoid the market in favor of selling stock to the firm.

Analysts said investors would approach the stock with caution, awaiting more positive quarterly earnings before buying. Loewen Ondaatje McCutcheon analyst Mark Lawrence said: "I think a lot of investors will sit on the sidelines for quite a while."
In other news, Cognos earned US$0.29 a share for the fourth-quarter ended February 28 versus year earlier US$0.16.
Market players sold Cognos was down following a share surge since mid-March.
